Module ZiqiYang
Package org.ziqi.model

Class Player

java.lang.Object
org.ziqi.gameEngine.base.GameObject
org.ziqi.model.Player
public class Player
extends GameObject
Player class as GameObject, possessing PlayerDirection and PlayerStatus enumeration.
Author:
Ziqi Yang
See Also:
GameObject

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Player.PlayerDirection
    PlayerDirection enumeration defines all facing direction of Player object.
    static class  Player.PlayerStatus
    PlayerStatus enumeration defines all status of Player object.

    • getSpriteNames

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getSpriteNames()
      Gets an arraylist of strings specifying all sprite path names of Player game object for ResourceManager to load from resource folder beforehand.
      Returns:
      An arraylist of strings specifying all sprite path names is returned.
      See Also:
      ResourceManager, ResourceManager.loadSpritesFromResource(HashMap), Player.PlayerStatus.toString(), Player.PlayerDirection.toString()

    • move

      public boolean move​(java.awt.Point direction)
      Checks if the Player can move to given direction.
      This method will get all targets at the moving direction of the Player and call their the override move method to check:
      This method is called by PlayerController when handling valid user input(move).
      Specified by:
      move in class GameObject
      Parameters:
      direction - A Point object specifying the direction vector the GameObject to be moved to.
      Returns:
      Boolean value specifying if the pusher(player) can move is returned;
      If so, then the Player is moved to new position, move count increment according to current status(FLYING/grounded) and true is returned to specify the player has moved;
      Otherwise, false is returned.
      See Also:
      DataManager.incrementMoveCount(int), PlayerController, Layer

    • updatePlayerStatus

      public void updatePlayerStatus​(javafx.scene.input.KeyCode code, java.awt.Point direction)
      Updates the player status and facing direction by given key code and direction.
      If SPACE is pressed by user, then this method call checkFlyingStatus() to handle flying status switching;
      Otherwise, checkMovingStatus() is called.
      Parameters:
      code - The input key code by user.
      direction - The new facing direction.
      See Also:
      PlayerController, checkFlyingStatus(), checkMovingStatus(KeyCode, Point)

    • checkFlyingStatus

      private void checkFlyingStatus()
      Checks current flying/ground status and updates new player status.
      If player is grounded, then updates status to flying-off.
      If player is flying, then check if player can land. If so, player status will be set as landing. Otherwise, alert sound effect wil be played.
      See Also:
      MusicManager.playCannotLandMusic()

    • checkMovingStatus

      private void checkMovingStatus​(javafx.scene.input.KeyCode code, java.awt.Point direction)
      Checks current moving status and facing direction and updates new player status.
